main event: On the night of November 25, 1957, SP-1 George H. Tyson reported an unidentified flying object hovering over a mountain in Seoul, Korea.
interesting points: The object was observed by ground-radar and air-visual means.
The motion of the object, including the alleged hovering, was considered an illusion created by the object moving away in the observer's line of sight.
The alleged hovering lasted for 2.5 seconds.
The report was classified as an 'Unidentified Flying Object Report (UFOB)'.
The report was prepared by SP-1 George H. Tyson.
result: The object was considered an illusion created by the object moving away in the observer's line of sight.
